result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Carl Erickson

8:40 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Andrew Carl Erickson in court.  Attorney Barry Curtis Lundeen in court for Andrew Carl Erickson.Atty. Court will not address bond modification at this time. State will file motion if necessary after meeting with Victim. Court sets PLEAS. Adjourned: 8:43 AM. kma

Misdemeanor and Criminal Traffic Scheduling Order. Signed by SJN on 6/21/2022. c: DA and Atty via e-file. km
Filed by DA Office Karn W. arc

Settlement conference on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

BOND ON FILE

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Victoria Erickson.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:48 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY:  Barry Curtis Lundeen, DF:  Andrew Carl Erickson appeared. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG. Waives speedy trial. State requests bond. Atty. Lundeen makes bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 1:51 PM. kma  Settlement conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
